description: Configuration table for Python packages to track on PyPI

columns.name: package_name
columns.description: Python package name as it appears on PyPI (e.g., 'couchbase', 'langchain-couchbase')

columns.name: tab_name
columns.description: Google Sheets tab name where statistics for this package will be saved
columns.notes: Must match existing tab name in Google Sheets or will be created automatically

columns.name: is_enabled
columns.description: Whether to track statistics for this package. Unchecked packages are skipped.

usage.purpose: Store list of Python packages to track monthly download statistics from PyPI

setup_instructions.step_1: In n8n, navigate to Data â†’ Tables (or similar menu)
setup_instructions.step_4: Add columns as defined in the 'columns' array above
setup_instructions.step_7: Verify the table appears in the n8n Data section

adding_new_packages.description: To track additional Python packages in the future:
steps: Open the python_packages data table in n8n
- package_name: The PyPI package name (must exist on pypi.org)
- tab_name: Google Sheets tab to save results (will be created if doesn't exist)
- is_enabled: Check to enable tracking, uncheck to skip
Next scheduled workflow run will include this package

example_packages.notes: Async Couchbase client (if tracked in future)

maintenance.disabling_packages: Uncheck 'is_enabled' to stop tracking without deleting historical data
maintenance.updating_tab_names: Change 'tab_name' to redirect output to different Google Sheets tab
maintenance.removing_packages: Delete row to permanently stop tracking (loses configuration)

google_sheets_integration.note: Ensure tabs listed in 'tab_name' column exist in the spreadsheet, or workflow will create them automatically (depending on n8n Google Sheets node settings)
